pageContext.description: Long, socketed spear head, the socket being hollow to a distance of 6 5/8" (168.275mm) from shaft end, and continued as a solid rib to point. Two loop holes at base of blade. Slight chamfer along both edges, extending from the flattened edges of the loop holes to the point. One edge is badly damaged and the spear head has been broken across its width 5 1/4" (133.35mm) from the point.  There is a small hole near the central rib; the end of the socket is almost completely broken away leaving only 1/2" (12.7mm) of the edge. Small fragments of wood inside socket.
pageContext.surface: Smooth, unpitted, with very little corrosion, metal shows clearly but is blackish brown colour on greater part.
pageContext.other: Length: 15 3/8" = 390.525mm,Width: 2 1/8" at widest point = 53.975mm,Thickness: 1" (25.4mm) at haft end tapering to 1/8" at point (3.175mm).,Weight: 13 1/2 ozs. = 382.72 gms
pageContext.collection: Newark-on-Trent Municipal Museum, Accession no: 789-1,Preserted by Trent Navigation Co.
pageContext.site: England,Nottinghamshire,Gunthorpe,River Trent,Dredged from the River Trent at Gunthorpe about 1884
